data.text: @Stanley_Walker @astro_trader @richardbranson Cheers Stanley! I'll never fly Virgin again after some of the things Branson said about this country (also my doctor advises against it due to my gout).
@Teddyedward99 Our hiring policy is "pay peanuts, get monkeys", so I wouldn't be too surprised Ted me old lad.

@Entre_Adam @whtimes You're right Adam - the thought of this tarnishing the company's image is deeply concerning. Thanks for the heads up. I'll have the "brand management" bods on this overnight doing their best to put a bit of spin on this one.
@TonyPeck46 Too many staff if anything, Tone.
@Londinium_Life @Jim_Cornelius I'll challenge them in a fashion which I can't promise will be educated, but will certainly appeal to you if you're nostalgic for the 1950s.
@jameslowe01 Hi James! You should have come over and said hello. I was actually there to fire one of the duty managers (I like to have a bit of clearout at Christmas).
@SusanSpry All of our pigs in blankets are halal, if that's worth anything Sue.
@Hospitable_Me That really hurts. I do my best with the millions and millions of pounds I have at my disposal. You've really ruined my New Year's.
@scott68morton Take a chance take a chance take-a-take-a-Chancery Lane
@yurehgrabovskeh They're my political beliefs so therefore are too important not to plaster all over burger menus and the like
@thecheechman @LBC @mrjamesob I won't lie and say I'm not going to miss you, Cheech, and your wacky ways, but I'll get new friends who will love me for who I am!

@JeffreySParkes Thanks Jeffrey! There was such great energy at the rally - and I don't mind telling you that me and Kate polished off the evening sharing a bottle of Rioja back in my hotel room! (British Rioja, of course).
@ciaran4320 @ICiaranCostello @SpanishDan1 @IanDunt As long as the bananas are bendy again then as far as I'm concerned £39bn is a small price to pay.
@locard1000 Oh ho, ha ha! Wait till I tell my daughters that I'm trendy on Twitter!
@TomGardiner7 I can't wait to hear it Tom! Bognor is so often the subject of some joke or other. Hilarious little place!
@MarkBartlam Anyone who tries this in one of my luxury eateries is barred for life PLUS off my Christmas card list!
@thebrexits Thanks Marc! I too had a wee snifter afterwards, though in my case it was rubbing alcohol shakily self-administered in a shop doorway. Cheers!
@MarkWakerley You might think that. But it looks like I'm actually the sort of person who likes to bully people with money. Also can't laugh at himself: but was that ever really in doubt?
@AndyFalcons I couldn't say, Andy - I moved on to paint thinner years ago. It really hits the spot.
@JosBeal @Wetherspoon__UK A gentleman always removes his hat indoors. What are you, some kind of hippy?
@Jacquij3 Next time circumvent the problem entirely by ordering an old leather boot for dinner.

@esf71 @DeborahMeaden And if it wasn't for salt-of-the-earth fighters like me, Jacob Rees-Mogg and Paul Dacre standing up for the working Englishman then the EU would literally destroy all that is good about this island. They probably hate white vans and bulldog tattoos as well, I'd imagine.

@esf71 @DeborahMeaden I picture Richard the Lionheart (a true patriot), I picture Waterloo, I picture "Are You Being Served?" These are all things that faceless beaurocrats in Europe want to snatch away from honest grafters such as myself

@esf71 @DeborahMeaden The numbers will work themselves out, given enough time. That's the first thing they teach you at business night school. Anyway, when I think of Brexit I don't picture confusing statistics and all that boring stuff...
@kevingulliver @Channel4News I may be a bellend, but at 6'6" I hardly think I...oh.
@pwmusic @Channel4News As an old Greek philosopher once said, "You've got to know when to hold them, know when to fold them", and it's simple as that really.
@mrpure @Channel4News Empire ended?! Psshaw! The world looks on in envy at our firm but fair governance of the Pitcairn Islands and the Western Sovereign Base Area of Southern Cyprus.

@MikeASeaton I've walked Littlehampton's High Street after dark, Mike, and it's not an experience I'd wish on anyone. Ask the staff to blend 2 parts custard with 1 part Tabasco and you're halfway there.
@martinlamb That's the spirit Martin! I've had numerous letters from punters who just can't wait to try our non-EU drinks, such as our forthcoming Somalian lager, or our Azerbaijani sparkling wine.
@TonyPeck46 Someone's left a bit of their pint there! Kids in Africa would kill for those dregs!
@johnehonwheeler It's quite confusing but look: blue passports and properly bendy bananas are going to completely change your mind, mark my words
@johnallenbybath I never drink in yours either, John.
@bbcquestiontime I didn't say don't @ me, jeez Question Time

@JeffreySParkes Thanks Jeffrey. I fear my QT experience will be a poor one as BIASED BBC will no doubt have some members of the audience who will disagree with me. And I tell you what's wrong with politicians today: not enough hatred. Hatred gets things done. Bring back hanging and witch dunking
@geoffreygeorgep Ha ha! You would think so, wouldn't you.
@farthings3 This is why I tell Jeeves to drive the Jag round the block until I'm done.
@geoffreygeorgep It's been known to happen George
@katie15price @theresa_may Uniforms for taxi drivers
@benmmcd Thought you'd sent me a dick pic for a moment there, Ben. Your Thai bride certainly has that look of disappointment fairly well practised.
@KitCaless Well it's going in my basket, Kit! I've already seen most of them first hand, mind.
@SR_Chep @PHILROOKS @Wetherspoon__UK You start earning breaks once you receive your 10 years' service certificate
@derek_gledhill @Aviah_Sarah_Day @Wetherspoon__UK Oh baby I hear the blues a-callin', no bacon and crumbled eggs!
@derek_gledhill @Aviah_Sarah_Day @Wetherspoon__UK ...but otherwise you all had a cracking time?
@Aviah_Sarah_Day @Wetherspoon__UK Prostitutes have offices now?!
@jjacksonrfc Just let it run down your leg, John. Most of our customers have been using this technique for years.

@cat_voltaire Company policy to not serve racist idiots? If it wasn't before, consider this official confirmation that it is now. And tell that puce-faced thug "Tommy" that if I ever see him in one of my pubs I will personally hop in the Jag to come down and chin the twat.
@glen_gogerly Stroud is a bit out of my way, but maybe we could twos-up on a Travelodge if you don't mind top-to-tailing? Because a dirty weekend in Gloucestershire sounds right up my street, cor!
@___Hursty I told them to immediately serve the most miserable, smacked-arse face in the crowd
@alexgberry She has good taste! Tell the manager her first one is on me.
@MainsTracey How bad, Tracey? Say the word and I will fire them immediately, plunging them and their family into the pit of financial despair and possibly homelessness.
@ndmTW Sorry Andreas but you're wrong here. And anyway, I invented the Wetherspoons sharer - what have YOU ever done for this country?
@jessmahoneybl @Wetherspoon__UK Looks like the beans, bacon and eggs have gone missing too. I guess the frying basket can only hold so much in one go.

@Drag0n5layer1 @IanDunt Yes, but you'll be glad to pay double the price when we start to see all the tangible benefits of Brexit, like different-coloured passport covers, or Boris Johnson negotiating trade deals with Antigua as PM.
@IoiTherealnacho @Ja_Kxxy Yes I am.
@boastsid I've always thought that the Navy were the softest of the armed forces.
@GeetaSidhuRobb If you fancy grabbing a drink sometime, I happen to be the owner of a chain of nice little boozers...?
@youknowit0609 Look, it's all very confusing so cut me some slack, alright?
@azuretone That's not very nice! I have feelings too you know...
@JudgeRaymondo My wife said I looked very dapper!

@HeskethNick We are planning to introduce 'Bishop's Foetid Flatulence' by Dusty Codger Brewery as an in-app guest ale in all pubs. The bloke who brews it in his shed describes it as "warm brown swill", so I hear CAMRA are already pleased.

@ChrisAndLou1 Ah, the old Fort William branch...I've spent many an "audit" there passed out in a cubicle! In fact, my doctor blames the town for the significant scarring on my liver. It's a place known for its rain - and they're always "pouring" when I'm there!

@einkuhnergott @Chr_Cru @MedievalGinger @GeoLXIX Who even drinks German lager or Champage, anyway? Soon enough the Hollywood elite et al will be drinking scrumpy and brown ale brewed in a shed just off the M23. I can't wait - what about you?
@bingobrewster @LeaveEUOfficial We are in quite advanced talks with a Zambian supplier of pies, as it happens, so you won't be so smug when the Meat Parts Medley pie hits our tables from next spring!
@bingobrewster @LeaveEUOfficial I hear that Zambia are interested. Why are you people always so obsessed with the specifics? It'll all work out somehow *NEW* Bud Light £1.99 *NEW*
@jjacksonrfc There was a tornado in Dumbarton earlier today and lots of our stock just blew away! Did you not see it on the news? 💨💨💨

@MartinLittler @Arron_banks @DavidDavisMP @IDuncanSmithMP @Dyson @Nigel_Farage @DUPleader @LiamFox @giles_fraser @michaelgove @LiamHalligan @DanielJHannan @JuliaHB1 @KateHoeyMP @BorisJohnson @PutinRF_Eng I think I have the loveliest hair of this wild gang! (Excepting Boris, perhaps)
@chrisrankin @jk_rowling You never returned your apron. There's a bad reference headed your way when you apply to another budget pub chain. You've only yourself to blame, Chris.

@BrugesGroup @CraeNiall @BCU_CBS @MarstonsBrewery @Pubdefender1 @punchpubs @CAMRA_Official @EnterprisePub @deruytea @alexwickham @EuroGuido I'll probably keep the beer at the same price and pocket the difference, to be fair.

@rebekahcossey Get mummy and daddy to help you, and address your letter to:

Big Tim
c/o the sea
English Channel
@typisttrisha61 We ran out. There's your reason.
@barnsleyrunner Yeah but did you see that I've put more weird political rants on the beer mats? Did you see that? Pretty impressive, huh?
@GElsharief @TheNewEuropean Er, please get it right, Gail: A.A. Gill's Times review actually said that our pubs are *crap* places that serve *horrible* food

@kevinhollinrake @Ian_Fraser I'd still love to discuss some things with you Kevin, perhaps over a microwaved sausage & mash at the Three Tuns in Thirsk? I know 'cash for votes' is frowned on these days, but how does 'Wetherspoon vouchers for votes' sound? (DM me hun)

@marilynhansen11 @DeborahMeaden @Dyson @donnyc1975 Rees-Mogg is just the sort of plucky outsider we need to shake things up! Son of a blacksmith, he taught himself to read aged 13 and even now spends his weekends volunteering at soup kitchens. And I've never met a man with so much love in his heart as Steve Bannon.

@marilynhansen11 @DeborahMeaden @Dyson @donnyc1975 With respect, I suggest you read my two latest pieces in the Wetherspoon News, "We'll fight them on the beaches!" and "A secret cabal of evil EU globalists are conspiring to destabilise sterling and reduce the value of my shares by many millions". Both should enlighten you.
@marilynhansen11 @DeborahMeaden @Dyson With 40,000 staff, my business has what I call 'a human capital redundancies buffer'. Every healthy tree needs a good pruning now and again.
@PaigeWalkerX Pop into one of our pubs on any given weekend and you'll find there's plenty of pork to pull
@Julesbilly @OwenJones84 He...er, I...travel the world in a hot air balloon kept aloft by my windbaggery and propelled forward by my burning sense of self-importance.

@Julesbilly @OwenJones84 They want to think about putting their hand in their pocket occasionally! We have a very reasonable price for fish & chips (including drink!) which I'm sure they could stretch to. Small Pepsi or lemonade from just £1.29.
@graphy @johnbulllndn @Margin4Error @MetroUK I love KORMA, which we sell as part of our Curry Club, every Thursday
@welshwizard7 Goodbye, EP! Your cheery demeanour will be missed by all our bar staff, some of whom were inconsolable at the news you wouldn't be coming back.
@martyb49 Hello Marty! We do have one outlet in East London which allows dogs, so I suggest you move there. But where, you ask? BARKING, of course! Ha ha! Great stuff, say hi to Rex for me

@welshwizard7 Hi EP! So I've looked in to this, and here are my findings: 1. Average of 2 seconds to be served, 2. Appeared overstaffed, 3. Coffee machine running beautifully, 4. You have to wait until the microwave pings for food (3 minutes). Glad to have the opportunity to correct you, bye x

@aley_aa @Dyson @Arron_banks Unfortunately Ofcom insists that television news must be "impartial and accurate". Grrr! I'm with you though: someone (maybe that fresh young dynamo @rupertmurdoch?) should create a news channel that isn't beholden to those ridiculous standards.
@AndrewB_London @albawhitewolf Looks too sober for me.
@RichardBentall @BBCNewsnight I meant other businesses, Richard. Besides, I like to think of myself as a visionary and the voice of the people, so I get special dispensation.
@grimmers I was on Question Time the other day, if that counts...

@Drag0n5layer1 @GavinQuinney Boris is a saint and has assured me, over a dinner or two at the Ivy, that he never lies when conducting state business. And unless he was lying to me, that's the truth. And chums don't lie to each other, is what me and Boris both agreed over oysters at the Savoy Grill.

@Positiv_Change Well I'm not a racist and my best friends certainly aren't black, so I guess we've ironed this one out amicably enough. What do you think of our new range of English sparkling whites? I'm quite partial myself, ha ha! Great stuff! Thanks for your custom!

@Positiv_Change I think you overestimate how many of our largely Polish workforce understand the training. One of our area managers is a lesbian, too, so I think you'll find that we've got that particular base covered.

@pkerrchef No need to email! Just drop off a few hundred units at W'spoon House, Reeds Crescent, Watford and we will settle up with you on the doorstep. Unless you want it going through the books, in which case we might have a problem.

@Drag0n5layer1 @GavinQuinney The details aren't important. What part of "Brussels gravy train" is failing to fill you with rage? If I were to tell you "bendy bananas", would you not instantly understand? Fatcatssavethepoundeurocratsfightthemonthebeaches. You can thank me later.
@Positiv_Change See you in court! 🧜‍♀️🧜‍♀️🧜‍♀️
@techarl78 Tell your son that shandies are ladies' drinks. Real men drink muddy-looking best bitters - or VK Blue in the summer. Absolutely appalling. You must feel so ashamed.
@Simdoe67 I wouldn't complain, in that case! Ha ha! Wonderful stuff, thanks for stopping by, Tim

@SportingNest He's welcome to meet me in court. He wouldn't have...*drum rolls*...*throats clear*...*monkeys shriek*...*Wetherspoon board members bang on table*...*Nigel Farage guffaws*...*UK Gold schedules another 1000 episodes of Dad's Army*...A LEG TO STAND ON!!! HAW! HAW!
@able2uk We'll do quite well without her, thanks very much! Free pint with a curry on Thursdays, don't forget!
@peterconny61 @Patsyderb Or why not do everyone else a favour and take your White Lightning to a quiet spot in the park
@T0by_Says @George_S97 @jdwtweet Maybe if I drove a white van I would.

@JonnyLus @reptillacus @Dyson I hear James Dyson personally "tests" his vacuum cleaners before they roll off the production line, if you know what I mean. You'd think someone who has such luck with, er, hoovers would have less of a stick up his arse, but oh well

@George_S97 @jdwtweet What, exactly, did you order? List every item please. Also tell me the times of your orders. If you've been ordering milk every five minutes "for banter lolol" then I'll kick your spotty little arse all down the road, understand?
@George62113517 I take it you're an expert on ice cream, being such a huge melt

@Patsyderb I'll work with you on this one, but I want a thorough breakdown of • How much the dog spends per visit • Whether or not it will make complaints about the smell of our customers • The dog's views on Brexit
@southsea8 @OldBobCyprus Ian Huntley committed vile acts against children while we were in the EU as well. Coincidence? That's probably what communist types like the CBI want you to think.
@cymboi @jdwtweet Yes, having a set time is a good idea. Everyone knows where they stand that way. Let's say one minute past midnight.
@KarenStuelW I'd be more than happy to attend! I won't cross into Wales, mind. Just be aware. But this side of the border is fine.
@Patsyderb No can do! However should you at any point go blind you are more than welcome to bring a guide dog in, god bless
@ygrittred @jdwtweet Our prices increase in line with dole payment rises.
@ygrittred @jdwtweet I'll explain: doing this means the company makes more money. Good day.
@DrewMcconville @jdwtweet Even ants have to eat! Nice of you to share - the little fella looked well happy with his plate of brown slop. No refund, but maybe you could go halves with the ant.
@HenryStreet3 I loved it, Phil. It was quality, Street.
@RoaringNurse @jdwtweet I meant that we'd be using cheaper ingredients to make the microwaved lasagne. I'm not passing on any savings - I didn't become a multimillionaire doing that!

@CarpeZytha @oldmudgie The staff thank you Xmas video (not making that up) will feature bigwigs such as Sue Cacioppo, myself and John Hutson ("Misery with a Rolex" we call him) miming along to the lesser known Stones hit "Hey, E.U., Get Off Of My Cloud!" Does wonders for morale every year.
@CarpeZytha @oldmudgie I've instructed all PMs to remove the accent from "Rosé on tap" chalkboard scribblings. Just don't need that kind of frou-frou nonsense in my boozers.
@StevenH81624303 Brexit beer mats are expensive. And what, am I supposed to just stop printing them? Like other, more professional companies? Christ no.
@SimonAppleby @jdwtweet @Joanna_Nance If you knew what went into those hot dogs you wouldn't be so keen. "Unknown parts from parts unknown" is all I'm saying.

@niceguyglen Whatever mental acrobatics I was performing with that one, Glen, rest assured it had something to do with lowering taxes on some gubbins or other and therefore putting more money in my pocket. Someone once asked why I didn't crusade against low wages...well I'm not poor! Ha!
@metpoliceuk @mrchrisaddison Has anyone tried ringing him?
@LisaFoxWrites @jdwtweet Maybe you should have sent him a grilled cheese and tuna sandwich, because your brother is a little melt
@mikeparry8 @jdwtweet Lovely to meet you, @mikeparry8! Sorry I couldn't stay longer but I had to get to my @AlcholicsAnonAA meeting #2dayssober #courtorder
@social_lib74 Er, excuse me, but do I LOOK like I'm full of crap?

@scottdaddypig @jdwtweet Hi Scott! Sorry that reducing plastic waste had to come at the expense of your fussy kids' preferences. And is that a psychological issue your girlfriend has? I bet she's had her lips round worse things (or so the local rugby team tells me).

@50degreesam @Andy21554010 @skysarahjane @SkyNews As long as I remain filthy rich then I don't care what you people do. I'd like to see VAT cut for on-trade businesses. Make it up by taxing nurses more or something.
@chrisframe9 @jdwtweet @tiffins11 TO EXPLICITLY PISS YOU OFF, there, are you happy now?
@jdwtweet @topemployer We don't let them unionize, though. Don't want them getting ideas above their station.
@dixieland7 I guess we really goofed with this one! Regardless, many Spoons pubs have simply fabulous interiors, wouldn't you agree?
@lucyjane954 Tell Grant to stick his hands in his pockets for once. Tight bastard.
@antivist @MrEvilSkeletor @jdwtweet Some of them have false teeth, so he's dead wrong there
@Duncyano @Chrisitv I never explicitly said that, Duncan. They're a mixed bunch, let's just say. Some, I assume, might have some GCEs but this isn't a subject I want to get in to right now.

Our media relations man, Eddie Gershon, has simply said it's down to 'supply issues'. No mention of 'non-compliance with food hygiene regulations'. Must have forgotten that bit! After all, we want our customers to know WHAT the supply issues are, right? They're not idio--oh.

Our meat supplier, #RussellHume, has been shut down by the FSA due to 'serious non-compliance with food hygiene regulations'. This is why we don't have any steak. We use only the best quality ingredients, honest, so I guess we will chalk this up to 'whoopsie!' #Wetherspoons
@jdwtweet Don't forget, this is the award winning haggis which is actually not award winning.
@caitlyn_hoolan Just got off the phone to the manager in question. He says you and your friends were being proper mugs. Issue resolved, cheers, Tim

@MatthewRimmer @childwall5ways @jdwtweet Makes you wonder what kind of pub it is if there's a need for CCTV IN the toilets. Perhaps it's a condition of the venue's license? In which case it may have problems with drug use. I'll ask one of the team. Bye.
@BeefeaterDave @jdwtweet Sure you just can't aim, Dave?
@bethg0903 @jdwtweet Ask the picky little sod what's wrong with a beer and a burger deal? That's what us hoi polloi eat. Too common for Little Lord Fauntleroy?
@JamieJoeTweets @jdwtweet If you brought your entire constituency then it sounds like a matter for your local MP.
@abbieshipperley @bhx_official @jdwtweet Maybe if you didn't go through life addressing people as 'absolute gimps' straight from the off then they'd be more inclined to be sympathetic.

@AndySilverwood @jdwtweet @mayor_anderson Haven't you seen me on TV?! I'm too drunk to take anything seriously. You'll be telling the staff to unionize next, not that we allow them to. But anyway, we can replace a Pawel or a Bogdan with a Ting Tong or a M'bongo any day of the week. My red nose? Just the cold air, my boy!
@littlebrown 25 hours. I chartered a dinghy so I could cross time zones in order to finish Spot Goes to the Circus.

@AdamLarke87 @jdwtweet Good luck: you're now barred from The Picture Palace, Braintree. Also passed your name and picture to Braintree Pubwatch. Send me a personal letter (to Head Office, Watford; address on website) containing a grovelling apology and I might let you back in for soft drinks only.

@embedded_iot @katelallyx @jdwtweet Apologies for this Alex. We had to destroy all stock of Erdinger because an eagle-eyed member of staff noticed that the whole lot was cloudy! Will be back soon. Cheers, Tim.
@NeilCampbell678 @saxoncrowncorby @jdwtweet You do look a little like the Creature from the Black Lagoon, Neil. We're just trying to keep it homely for you.
@CarpeZytha @jdwtweet We discovered that the trick is to simply run out of everything at the busiest times
@jdwtweet @Sparkypatrick Sorry we're shit. Thanks for calling.
@jonesrphil @jdwtweet Obviously didn't finish you off on this occasion, but we'll get you next time!
@ph_milesoleary @jdwtweet How did you end up looking stupid? Did you open your mouth?

@El_Tommo90 @jdwtweet Many would pay at least £5 for that delicious morsel, Tom. What an absolute steal. Bet it really set you up for your holiday to Benidorm, or wherever people like you go on holiday

@angryaboutbikes Hi Bill. I don't understand the problem - this is an example of the exciting, forward-thinking fusion cuisine our company is known for. It looks great. What a pairing. You'll be telling your friends about this dining experience for years to come. Regards, Tim.
@LowriSerenx @jdwtweet Oh just you wait, we can top that I'm sure, given time...
@BeneaththeBrush @jdwtweet I hope you shovelled that fackin' gorgeous bit of grub down ya gullet doublequick! It looks absolutely deelish!
@JNAPDR @jdwtweet And Lord knows they don't moan as much, ha ha! Great stuff, cheers
@SimonWard72 @vegantrademark @jdwtweet @TheVeganSociety I bet it was delicious though! Don't pretend you weren't hankering for a lovely bit of grilled chicken after 12 years, Simon me old fruit!
@adahallett @jdwtweet Glad it was all cleared up Andy! Look forward to seeing you again soon :)
@JNAPDR @jdwtweet Maybe you could have got one of your grandchildren to help you with the app? It can be a bit confusing for us old timers!
@JaneCColby @jdwtweet Thanks for this mood board of emotions. What a rollercoaster ride.

@MartinOwens @coffinlength @jdwtweet Guarantee this was a 'hilarious' order for 'bantz' purposes only. You can recoup your £1.50 the way all your fellow Scotsmen earn their money: with an upturned cap in a Primark doorway.
@TrumpkinOut @FullerDenis @ScrewBrexit @evz76 @Digbylj @MichaelGoveMP SHUT UP! SHUT UP! SHUT UP! CRUSH THE SABOTEURS!
@danrawle @jdwtweet Nothing gets past you, Dan Rawle, especially not our cold veggie burgers! But we'll keep trying, don't you worry! P.S. Good luck with your GCSEs!

@twm1310 @jdwtweet Sorry Tara, but do you have any idea how much effort our chefs put into their creations? Do you realise that each one must complete a five-year finishing course at the Savoy Grill in London? They're true artists, and if you can't appreciate our gourmet frozen fare then I pity you
@PAULDREWERY @jdwtweet Turns out they were disgusting. Who'd have thought that some microwaved veg and reheated chicken wouldn't taste that amazing?

@jdwtweet Half a bottle of J&B and I was straight onto Eddie Gershon, Media Relations Manager, "Eddie! Get me Shhhky Newsh! The world...*hic*...the world needsh to know...I've figured it out, Eddie...the WTO...lizard people...global conshpiracy...*hic*...EDDIE! Whersh my comb...oh god..."
@bainerz_1 @jdwtweet The fire alarm was set off by your burning sense of injustice.

@MindedMusically Much like first aiders, each outlet should have a member of staff who can read - this is usually, but not always, the pub manager. Ask at the bar for a trained reader to check it out, and if necessary, call the Wetherspoon Brexit Beer Mat Department at head office.
@Jentolton @jdwtweet Wait till you hear what our buffalo wings are made of...
@brightonargus We've all been there.
@Drunk_Mike @jdwtweet What incentive is there, if you keep returning to order more breakfasts? "Oh, it's only for saddo Mike again, don't bother to cook this one."
@LewZell @jdwtweet What can we say? Maybe 31 will be the charm. Maybe 31,000 will be. Are you a patient man?

@MailOnlineVideo @NTPWR @MailOnline May the Daily Mail, of 'Hurrah for the Blackshirts' and 'Is there no one left in Britain who can make a sandwich?' headlines past, use your video to sell more advertising space on its website?

@Aver4geJ0e @JonMDexter I couldn't agree more. Nothing would be more hilarious than seeing you shriek "I want to speak to a manager!" to a bleep-blooping robot which gives even less of a shit about your snotty egg than the surly teenagers we had thitherto employed.
@FunkyaMonkey @jdwtweet They're a delicacy in Malaya. When oh when will the British palate enter the 21st century!

@charlie_farrari @jdwtweet Hi Carlie. We printed your complaint out and made it into a paper aeroplane, it was great fun! Haven't laughed so hard at work for ages. In the end it flew out the window, haha! What was it about again?
@MacWreg @HousesVictorian @archpics Yeah, "Tim Wetherspoon" is part of a property consortium also comprised of Uncle Ben, Aunt Bessie and Ronald McDonald
@GabeUKSaintsFan I said I think we've, run out of baked beans
@Darrensziall @jdwtweet Did you get a grown up to help you with your complaint?
@BecTilley @jdwtweet At least that strange lot who frequent pubs to buy booze didn't have to wait for 15 people to order coffee in front of them.
@jdwtweet @joshbythesea @FTAlphaville First thing you learn in business school, Josh, is that Brexit beer mats don't pay for themselves.
@RapidBI @jdwtweet First against the wall, eh Mike?
@UBS @ZiaKhanNYC @RockefellerFdn Looks like one of the Tracy boys from Thunderbirds

@RealCFrampton @msc_nutrition How much do you want to promote Wetherspoons? You don't have to actually eat the food, just pose on the cover of Wetherspoon News with a balled fist and a bowl of our microwaved carbonara in the other hand. Maybe put your face on the beer mats, I dunno. Marketing will sort it.
@ChukaUmunna @jdwtweet @Open_Britain @theJeremyVine @LeaveWatch_ @BBCRealityCheck Care to settle this in the ring like men? All proceeds to Oxfam?
